doc.previous: During the reign of Philip III and Philip IV of Spain Madrid saw a period of exceptional cultural brilliance with the presence of geniuses such as Miguel de Cervantes Diego Vel zquez Francisco de Quevedo and Lope de Vega 45
doc.after: The death of Charles II of Spain resulted in the War of the Spanish succession The city supported the claim of Philip of Anjou as Philip V While the city was occupied in 1706 by a Portuguese army who proclaimed king the Archduke Charles of Austria under the name of Charles III and again in 1710 remained loyal to Philip V
